lessons.Subject: Mathematics

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: use knowledge of laws of arithmetic and order of operations to simplify calculations

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand that brackets can be used to alter the order of operations

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: estimate and multiply whole numbers up to 10 000 by 1-digit or 2-digit whole numbers

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: estimate and divide whole numbers up to 1000 by 1-digit or 2-digit whole numbers

lessons.Learning Objective: understand common multiples and common factors

lessons.Learning Objective: use knowledge of multiplication and square numbers to recognise cube numbers (from 1 to 125)

lessons.Learning Objective: understand and explain the value of each digit in decimals (tenths; hundredths and thousandths)

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: use knowledge of place value to multiply and divide whole numbers and decimals by 10; 100 and 1000

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: compose; decompose and regroup numbers; including decimals (tenths; hundredths and thousandths)

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Estimate; add and subtract integers; recognising generalisations.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that brackets; positive indices and operations follow a particular order.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand lowest common multiple and highest common factor (numbers less than 100).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of tests of divisibility to find factors of numbers greater than 100.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand the relationship between squares and corresponding square roots; and cubes and corresponding cube roots.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of place value to multiply and divide whole numbers and decimals by any positive power of 10.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Round numbers to a given number of decimal places.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Recognise that fractions; terminating decimals and percentages have equivalent values.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Estimate and add mixed numbers; and write the answer as a mixed number in its simplest form.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Estimate; multiply and divide proper fractions.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of common factors; laws of arithmetic and order of operations to simplify calculations containing decimals or fractions.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Recognise percentages of shapes and whole numbers; including percentages less than 1 or greater than 100.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand the relative size of quantities to compare and order decimals and fractions; using the symbols =; ≠; > and <.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Estimate; add and subtract positive and negative numbers with the same or different number of decimal places.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Estimate; multiply and divide decimals by whole numbers.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand and use the unitary method to solve problems involving ratio and direct proportion in a range of contexts.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand how ratios are used to compare quantities to divide an amount into a given ratio with two parts.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that letters can be used to represent unknown numbers; variables or constants.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that the laws of arithmetic and order of operations apply to algebraic terms and expressions (four operations).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand how to manipulate algebraic expressions including: collecting like terms; applying the distributive law with a constant.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that a situation can be represented either in words or as an algebraic expression; and move between the two representations (linear with integer coefficients).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that a situation can be represented either in words or as a formula (single operation); and move between the two representations.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that a situation can be represented either in words or as an equation. Move between the two representations and solve the equation (integer coefficients; unknown on one side).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that letters can represent an open interval (one term).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand term-to-term rules; and generate sequences from numerical and spatial patterns (linear and integers).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand and describe nth term rules algebraically (in the form n ± a; a × n where a is a whole number).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that a function is a relationship where each input has a single output. Generate outputs from a given function and identify inputs from a given output by considering inverse operations (linear and integers).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that a situation can be represented either in words or as a linear function in two variables (of the form y = x + c or y = mx); and move between the two representations.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of coordinate pairs to construct tables of values and plot the graphs of linear functions; where y is given explicitly in terms of x (y = x + c or y = mx).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Recognise straight-line graphs parallel to the x- or y-axis.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Read and interpret graphs related to rates of change. Explain why they have a specific shape.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify; describe and sketch regular polygons; including reference to sides; angles and symmetrical properties.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that if two 2D shapes are congruent; corresponding sides and angles are equal.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Know the parts of a circle: centre; radius; diameter; circumference; chord; tangent.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand the relationships and convert between metric units of area; including hectares (ha); square metres (m²); square centimetres (cm²) and square millimetres (mm²).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Derive and know the formula for the area of a triangle. Use the formula to calculate the area of triangles and compound shapes made from rectangles and triangles.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify and describe the combination of properties that determine a specific 3D shape.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Derive and use a formula for the volume of a cube or cuboid. Use the formula to calculate the volume of compound shapes made from cuboids; in cubic metres (m3); cubic centimetres (cm3) and cubic millimetres (mm3).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Visualise and represent front; side and top view of 3D shapes.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of area; and properties of cubes and cuboids to calculate their surface area.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify reflective symmetry and order of rotational symmetry of 2D shapes and patterns.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Derive the property that the sum of the angles in a quadrilateral is 360°; and use this to calculate missing angles.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that the sum of the angles around a point is 360º; and use this to calculate missing angles.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Recognise the properties of angles on: parallel lines and transversals; perpendicular lines; intersecting lines.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Draw parallel and perpendicular lines; and quadrilaterals.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of scaling to interpret maps and plans.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of 2D shapes and coordinates to find the distance between two coordinates that have the same x or y coordinate (without the aid of a grid).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of translation of 2D shapes to identify the corresponding points between the original and the translated image; without the use of a grid.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Reflect 2D shapes on coordinate grids; in a given mirror line (x- or y-axis); recognising that the image is congruent to the object after a reflection.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Rotate shapes 90° and 180° around a centre of rotation; recognising that the image is congruent to the object after a rotation.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that the image is mathematically similar to the object after enlargement. Use positive integer scale factors to perform and identify enlargements.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Select and trial data collection and sampling methods to investigate predictions for a set of related statistical questions; considering what data to collect (categorical; discrete and continuous data).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand the effect of sample size on data collection and analysis.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Record; organise and represent categorical; discrete and continuous data. Choose and explain which representation to use in a given situation: Venn and Carroll diagrams; tally charts; frequency tables and two-way tables; dual and compound bar charts; waffle diagrams and pie charts; frequency diagrams for continuous data; line graphs; scatter graphs; infographics.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of mode; median; mean and range to describe and summarise large data sets. Choose and explain which one is the most appropriate for the context.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Interpret data; identifying patterns; within and between data sets; to answer statistical questions. Discuss conclusions; considering the sources of variation; including sampling; and check predictions.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use the language associated with probability and proportion to describe; compare; order and interpret the likelihood of outcomes.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand and explain that probabilities range from 0 to 1; and can be represented as proper fractions; decimals and percentages.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify all the possible mutually exclusive outcomes of a single event; and recognise when they are equally likely to happen.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand how to find the theoretical probabilities of equally likely outcomes.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Design and conduct chance experiments or simulations; using small and large numbers of trials. Analyse the frequency of outcomes to calculate experimental probabilities.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that brackets; indices (square and cube roots) and operations follow a particular order.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Estimate; multiply and divide integers; recognising generalisations.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand the hierarchy of natural numbers; integers and rational numbers.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use positive and zero indices; and the index laws for multiplication and division.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Recognise squares of negative and positive numbers; and corresponding square roots.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Recognise positive and negative cube numbers; and the corresponding cube roots.

lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of place value to multiply and divide integers and decimals by 0.1 and 0.01.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Round numbers to a given number of significant figures.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Recognise fractions that are equivalent to recurring decimals.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Estimate and subtract mixed numbers; and write the answer as a mixed number in its simplest form.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Estimate and multiply an integer by a mixed number; and divide an integer by a proper fraction.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of the laws of arithmetic and order of operations (including brackets) to simplify calculations containing decimals or fractions.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand percentage increase and decrease; and absolute change.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand the relative size of quantities to compare and order decimals and fractions (positive and negative); using the symbols =; ≠; >; <; ≤ and ≥.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Estimate and multiply decimals by integers and decimals.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Estimate and divide decimals by numbers with one decimal place.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand and use the relationship between ratio and direct proportion.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of equivalence to simplify and compare ratios (different units).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand how ratios are used to compare quantities to divide an amount into a given ratio with two or more parts.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that letters have different meanings in expressions; formulae and equations.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that the laws of arithmetic and order of operations apply to algebraic terms and expressions (four operations; squares and cubes).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand how to manipulate algebraic expressions including: applying the distributive law with a single term (squares and cubes); identifying the highest common factor to factorise.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that a situation can be represented either in words or as an algebraic expression; and move between the two representations (linear with integer or fractional coefficients).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that a situation can be represented either in words or as a formula (mixed operations); and manipulate using knowledge of inverse operations to change the subject of a formula.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that a situation can be represented either in words or as an equation. Move between the two representations and solve the equation (integer or fractional coefficients; unknown on either or both sides).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that letters can represent open and closed intervals (two terms).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand term-to-term rules; and generate sequences from numerical and spatial patterns (including fractions).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand and describe nth term rules algebraically (in the form n ± a; a × n; or an ± b; where a and b are positive or negative integers or fractions).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that a function is a relationship where each input has a single output. Generate outputs from a given function and identify inputs from a given output by considering inverse operations (including fractions).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that a situation can be represented either in words or as a linear function in two variables (of the form y = mx + c); and move between the two representations.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of coordinate pairs to construct tables of values and plot the graphs of linear functions; where y is given explicitly in terms of x (y = mx + c).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Recognise that equations of the form y = mx + c correspond to straight-line graphs; where m is the gradient and c is the y-intercept (integer values of m).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Read and interpret graphs with more than one component. Explain why they have a specific shape and the significance of intersections of the graphs.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify and describe the hierarchy of quadrilaterals.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand π as the ratio between a circumference and a diameter. Know and use the formula for the circumference of a circle.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that distances can be measured in miles or kilometres; and that a kilometre is approximately 5/8 of a mile or a mile is 1.6 kilometres.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand and use Euler’s formula to connect number of vertices; faces and edges of 3D shapes.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of area and volume to derive the formula for the volume of a triangular prism. Use the formula to calculate the volume of triangular prisms.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Represent front; side and top view of 3D shapes to scale.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of area; and properties of cubes; cuboids; triangular prisms and pyramids to calculate their surface area.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that the number of sides of a regular polygon is equal to the number of lines of symmetry and the order of rotation.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Derive and use the fact that the exterior angle of a triangle is equal to the sum of the two interior opposite angles.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Recognise and describe the properties of angles on parallel and intersecting lines; using geometric vocabulary such as alternate; corresponding and vertically opposite.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Construct triangles; midpoint and perpendicular bisector of a line segment; and the bisector of an angle.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand and use bearings as a measure of direction.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of coordinates to find the midpoint of a line segment.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Translate points and 2D shapes using vectors; recognising that the image is congruent to the object after a translation.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Reflect 2D shapes and points in a given mirror line on or parallel to the x- or y-axis; or y = ± x on coordinate grids. Identify a reflection and its mirror line.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that the centre of rotation; direction of rotation and angle are needed to identify and perform rotations.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Enlarge 2D shapes; from a centre of enlargement (outside or on the shape) with a positive integer scale factor. Identify an enlargement and scale factor.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Select; trial and justify data collection and sampling methods to investigate predictions for a set of related statistical questions; considering what data to collect (categorical; discrete and continuous data).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand the advantages and disadvantages of different sampling methods.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Record; organise and represent categorical; discrete and continuous data. Choose and explain which representation to use in a given situation: Venn and Carroll diagrams; tally charts; frequency tables and two-way tables; dual and compound bar charts; pie charts; frequency diagrams for continuous data; line graphs and time series graphs; scatter graphs; stem-and-leaf diagrams; infographics.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of mode; median; mean and range to compare two distributions; considering the interrelationship between centrality and spread.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Interpret data; identifying patterns; trends and relationships; within and between data sets; to answer statistical questions. Discuss conclusions; considering the sources of variation; including sampling; and check predictions.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that complementary events are two events that have a total probability of 1.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that tables; diagrams and lists can be used to identify all mutually exclusive outcomes of combined events (independent events only).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand how to find the theoretical probabilities of equally likely combined events.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Design and conduct chance experiments or simulations; using small and large numbers of trials. Compare the experimental probabilities with theoretical outcomes.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand the difference between rational and irrational numbers.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use positive; negative and zero indices; and the index laws for multiplication and division.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand the standard form for representing large and small numbers.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of square and cube roots to estimate surds.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Multiply and divide integers and decimals by 10 to the power of any positive or negative number.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that when a number is rounded there are upper and lower limits for the original number.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Deduce whether fractions will have recurring or terminating decimal equivalents.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Estimate; add and subtract proper and improper fractions; and mixed numbers; using the order of operations.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Estimate; multiply and divide fractions; interpret division as a multiplicative inverse; and cancel common factors before multiplying or dividing.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of the laws of arithmetic; inverse operations; equivalence and order of operations (brackets and indices) to simplify calculations containing decimals and fractions.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand compound percentages.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Estimate; multiply and divide decimals by integers and decimals.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand the relationship between two quantities when they are in direct or inverse proportion.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of ratios and equivalence for a range of contexts.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that the laws of arithmetic and order of operations apply to algebraic terms and expressions (four operations and integer powers).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand how to manipulate algebraic expressions including: expanding the product of two algebraic expressions; applying the laws of indices; simplifying algebraic fractions.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that a situation can be represented either in words or as an algebraic expression; and move between the two representations (including squares; cubes and roots).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that a situation can be represented either in words or as a formula (including squares and cubes); and manipulate using knowledge of inverse operations to change the subject of a formula.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that a situation can be represented either in words or as an equation. Move between the two representations and solve the equation (including those with an unknown in the denominator).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that the solution of simultaneous linear equations: is the pair of values that satisfy both equations; can be found algebraically (eliminating one variable); can be found graphically (point of intersection).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that a situation can be represented either in words or as an inequality. Move between the two representations and solve linear inequalities.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Generate linear and quadratic sequences from numerical patterns and from a given term-to-term rule (any indices).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand and describe nth term rules algebraically (in the form an ± b; where a and b are positive or negative integers or fractions; and in the form n2; n3 or n2 ± a; where a is a whole number).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that a function is a relationship where each input has a single output. Generate outputs from a given function and identify inputs from a given output by considering inverse operations (including indices).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that a situation can be represented either in words or as a linear function in two variables (of the form y = mx + c or ax + by = c); and move between the two representations.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of coordinate pairs to construct tables of values and plot the graphs of linear functions; including where y is given implicitly in terms of x (ax + by = c); and quadratic functions of the form y = x2 ± a.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that straight-line graphs can be represented by equations. Find the equation in the form y = mx + c or where y is given implicitly in terms of x (fractional; positive and negative gradients).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Read; draw and interpret graphs and use compound measures to compare graphs.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Know and use the formulae for the area and circumference of a circle.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Know and recognise very small or very large units of length; capacity and mass.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Estimate and calculate areas of compound 2D shapes made from rectangles; triangles and circles.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of area and volume to derive the formula for the volume of prisms and cylinders. Use the formula to calculate the volume of prisms and cylinders.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of area; and properties of cubes; cuboids; triangular prisms; pyramids and cylinders to calculate their surface area.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify reflective symmetry in 3D shapes.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Derive and use the formula for the sum of the interior angles of any polygon.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that the sum of the exterior angles of any polygon is 360°.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use properties of angles; parallel and intersecting lines; triangles and quadrilaterals to calculate missing angles.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Know and use Pythagoras’ theorem.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Construct 60°; 45° and 30° angles and regular polygons.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of bearings and scaling to interpret position on maps and plans.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use knowledge of coordinates to find points on a line segment.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Transform points and 2D shapes by combinations of reflections; translations and rotations.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify and describe a transformation (reflections; translations; rotations and combinations of these) given an object and its image.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Recognise and explain that after any combination of reflections; translations and rotations the image is congruent to the object.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Enlarge 2D shapes; from a centre of enlargement (outside; on or inside the shape) with a positive integer scale factor. Identify an enlargement; centre of enlargement and scale factor.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Analyse and describe changes in perimeter and area of squares and rectangles when side lengths are enlarged by a positive integer scale factor.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Select; trial and justify data collection and sampling methods to investigate predictions for a set of related statistical questions; considering what data to collect; and the appropriateness of each type (qualitative or quantitative; categorical; discrete or continuous).

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Explain potential issues and sources of bias with data collection and sampling methods; identifying further questions to ask.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Record; organise and represent categorical; discrete and continuous data. Choose and explain which representation to use in a given situation: Venn and Carroll diagrams; tally charts; frequency tables and two-way tables; dual and compound bar charts; pie charts; line graphs; time series graphs and frequency polygons; scatter graphs; stem-and-leaf and back-to-back stem-and-leaf diagrams; infographics.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Use mode; median; mean and range to compare two distributions; including grouped data.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Interpret data; identifying patterns; trends and relationships; within and between data sets; to answer statistical questions. Make informal inferences and generalisations; identifying wrong or misleading information.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that the probability of multiple mutually exclusive events can be found by summation and all mutually exclusive events have a total probability of 1.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify when successive and combined events are independent and when they are not.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand how to find the theoretical probabilities of combined events.

lessons.Subject: Mathematics
lessons.Learning Objective: Design and conduct chance experiments or simulations; using small and large numbers of trials. Calculate the expected frequency of occurrences and compare with observed outcomes.
